page.title: 02BEAFORD VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The present hall was built in 1978 to replace an older building which had been erected in the early 1920's to celebrate the victory of 1919. The old hall was pulled down and the site sold; a new site was donated by a local farmer; a local architect planned the design; and a local builder did the construction. The hall committee, helped by various grants, raised the Â£40,000 needed, by holding fetes, revels and sales. The hall is in very active use for the following:- badminton, a youth club, Women's Institute, occassional dances and discos, whist drives, sales, fetes, some Beaford Centre Activities, local drama group, school P.E. The main hall is very large, with adjoining kitchen/committee room, store, and toilets.
